column2: 1) [C, U] (AmE) a ceremony at which university, college, or high school students receive their diplomas（大学或高中的）毕业典礼
column3: e.g. The high school [[commencement]] speaker was giving a rather inspiring address.；e.g. Would passengers please turn off their mobile phones before the [[commencement]] of the flight?

column2: 2) [U] the beginning of sth. 开始；开端
column3: e.g. The high school [[commencement]] speaker was giving a rather inspiring address.；e.g. Would passengers please turn off their mobile phones before the [[commencement]] of the flight?

column2: 1) [C, U] (AmE) all the teachers in a university （大学的）全体教员
column3: e.g. A drop in enrollment (招生人数) will affect students, [[faculty]], and administrators.；e.g. These plans were part of a reorganization that divided the university into six [[faculties]].

column2: 2) [C] a department or group of related departments within a university 系；部；院
column3: e.g. A drop in enrollment (招生人数) will affect students, [[faculty]], and administrators.；e.g. These plans were part of a reorganization that divided the university into six [[faculties]].

column2: 1) deal with a problem or difficult situation 处理，解决（问题或困境）
column3: e.g. You must [[confront]] your fears and doubts and take risks again and again.；e.g. Here are some problems that have [[confronted]] scientists all over the world in the past decade.

column2: 2) (of a problem or difficult situation) appear and need to be dealt with by sb. （问题或困境）临到···头上；使面对
column3: e.g. You must [[confront]] your fears and doubts and take risks again and again.；e.g. Here are some problems that have [[confronted]] scientists all over the world in the past decade.

column2: [C] (infml.) sb. who does not have the determination or courage to finish sth. that is difficult 遇到困难就放弃的人；半途而废的人
column3: e.g. I have asked you to do this tough task because I know you are not a [[quitter]].

column2: not very good 不太好的
column3: e.g. Tourists crowd the gift shops along the street to buy [[mediocre]] products at high prices.

column2: done too quickly and carelessly — used to show disapproval 马虎的，随便的，草率的（含贬义）
column3: e.g. She complained that the research project was delayed mainly due to [[slipshod]] management.

column2: willing to forgive 宽容的；宽大的
column3: e.g. The public was more [[forgiving]] of the president's mistakes than the press and fellow politicians.

column2: [C] a date or time by which you have to do or complete sth. 截止时间；最后期限
column3: e.g. Without extra help, it's going to be very difficult for us to meet the Friday [[deadline]].

column2: talking too much, esp. about unimportant things （尤指对琐事）喋喋不休的，饶舌的
column3: e.g. I had talked too much about myself and felt like a [[garrulous]] old fool.

column2: throw sth., esp. sth. light, with a quick gentle movement of your hand 扔，掷，抛（尤指轻的东西）
column3: e.g. She picked up the package and casually [[tossed]] it into her handbag.

column2: 1) slow in understanding; stupid 迟钝的；愚笨的
column3: e.g. It's such a simple question. If you don't understand then you are [[duller]] than I thought.；e.g. The documentary lasts for more than two-and-a-half hours, and there is scarcely a [[dull]] minute.

column2: 2) not interesting or exciting 无趣味的；不刺激的；不生动的
column3: e.g. It's such a simple question. If you don't understand then you are [[duller]] than I thought.；e.g. The documentary lasts for more than two-and-a-half hours, and there is scarcely a [[dull]] minute.

column2: not new, original, or clever; not showing any imagination 无创意的；缺乏想象力的
column3: e.g. He simply couldn't understand why she thought him to be a stiff and [[unimaginative]] person.

column2: [C, U] an exciting and unusual experience or situation that you imagine happening to you, but which will probably never happen 幻想；想象
column3: e.g. Young children sometimes cannot distinguish between [[fantasy]] and reality.

column2: [U, sing.]  a way of behaving which is intended to make people believe sth. that is not true 假装；作假；做作
column3: e.g. Now that the [[pretense]] was over, he could tell them what he really thought.

column2: (usu. before noun) following what is traditional or the way sth. has been done for a long time 依照传统的；符合习俗的
column3: e.g. It's not a hotel, in the [[conventional]] sense, but rather a whole village turned into a hotel.

column2: have a bad effect on sth. so that it is no longer attractive, enjoyable, useful, etc. 毁掉；糟蹋；破坏
column3: e.g. They had an entire week, so there was no need to rush into a conversation that might [[spoil]] everything.

column2: (~ sb. of sth.) prevent sb. from having sth., esp. sth. that they need or should have 剥夺
column3: e.g. Some people worry that the advances in information technology may [[deprive]] citizens of their privacy.

column2: enough in quantity or of a good enough quality for a particular purpose 足够的；充分的；合乎需要的
column3: e.g. The lunchtime menu is more than [[adequate]] to satisfy the biggest appetite.

column2: 1) helpful; making sure that people have what they need 关心的；肯帮忙的
column3: e.g. It is an excellent childcare center for babies as the staff are friendly, relaxed and [[attentive]].；e.g. People who watch news tend to be more [[attentive]] to what is on the screen.

column2: 2) listening or watching carefully and with interest 注意的；留心的；专心的
column3: e.g. It is an excellent childcare center for babies as the staff are friendly, relaxed and [[attentive]].；e.g. People who watch news tend to be more [[attentive]] to what is on the screen.

column2: [C] sb. who works with you and has a similar position 同事；同僚
column3: e.g. The manual explains what to do if a [[co-worker]] is injured and in need of medical attention.

column2: offend sb. by saying or doing sth. they think is rude 侮辱；冒犯
column3: e.g. In some cultures, you [[insult]] your host if you do not accept their offer of food.

column2: (fml.) in a very bad or dangerous condition 状况极坏的；非常危险的
column3: e.g. Relations between the two countries have been in a [[parlous]] state for some time.

column2: 1) allow people to do, say, or believe sth. without criticizing or punishing them 容忍；宽容
column3: e.g. According to the spokesperson, the government is not prepared to [[tolerate]] the situation any longer.；e.g. For years the workers have had to [[tolerate]] low wages and terrible working conditions.

column2: 2) be able to accept sth. unpleasant or difficult, even though you do not like it 忍受；忍耐
column3: e.g. According to the spokesperson, the government is not prepared to [[tolerate]] the situation any longer.；e.g. For years the workers have had to [[tolerate]] low wages and terrible working conditions.

column2: [C] a young person, usu. between the ages of 12 and 18, who is developing into an adult 青少年（常指12至18岁之间的人）
column3: e.g. We know that [[adolescents]] are neither children nor adults and they have specific developmental needs.

column2: (infml.) deliberately forget sth. you have learned, in order to change the way you do sth. 设法忘记，抛弃（已学会的东西）
column3: e.g. You must start by [[unlearning]] all the bad habits your previous piano teacher taught you!

column2: (only before noun) done in order to get ready for sth. 预备的；准备的
column3: e.g. Months of [[preparatory]] work needs to be done before construction work can really begin.

column2: 1) think carefully about what to say, and say it clearly 仔细思考并明确表达
column3: e.g. She has lots of good ideas, but she has difficulty [[formulating]] them in front of investors.；e.g. The city government is currently [[formulating]] policies on road expansion to solve traffic problems.

column2: 2) develop sth. such as a plan or a set of rules, and decide all the details of how it will be done 规划；制定；准备
column3: e.g. She has lots of good ideas, but she has difficulty [[formulating]] them in front of investors.；e.g. The city government is currently [[formulating]] policies on road expansion to solve traffic problems.

column2: allowing people to do, say, or believe what they want without criticizing or punishing them 宽容的；容忍的
column3: e.g. My friends are more [[tolerant]], more willing to accept me for what I am.

column2: increase sth. such as your knowledge, experience, or range of activities 增长（知识、经验等）；扩大（活动范围等）
column3: e.g. The course helps school-leavers [[broaden]] their knowledge of the world of work.

column2: used when saying what many people say or believe is true, esp. when you disagree with them 据说；据称；一般相信；一般看来
column3: e.g. He was [[supposedly]] delivering some papers to her but I think it was just an excuse to see her.

column2: 1) remove sth. completely 清除；消除；消灭
column3: e.g. Mr. Woods wants a convincing victory to [[erase]] doubts about his team's ability.；e.g. It appears the names were accidentally [[erased]] from the computer hard drive.

column2: 2) remove information from a computer memory or recorded sounds from a tape 删除（计算机文件）；抹去（磁带录音）
column3: e.g. Mr. Woods wants a convincing victory to [[erase]] doubts about his team's ability.；e.g. It appears the names were accidentally [[erased]] from the computer hard drive.

column2: [C] one of the two periods of time that a year at high schools and universities is divided into, esp. in the US（尤指美国中学和大学的）一学期，半学年
column3: e.g. I was finishing my last [[semester]] in college and trying to look for a job in my hometown.

column2: 1) [C] (AmE) a test that students take in the middle of a semester or quarter 期中考试2) [U] the middle period of an elected government's time in power （政府任期的）中期
column3: e.g. A commitment to making reforms to the care system will form part of tomorrow's [[midterm]] progress report.

column2: 1) (AmE) an important test that you take at the end of a particular class in high school or college（高中或大学的）期终考试
column3: e.g. He's through to the men's tennis [[final]] for the first time in his career.

column2: 2) the last and most important game, race, or set of games in a competition 决赛
column3: e.g. He's through to the men's tennis [[final]] for the first time in his career.

column2: (not before noun) expected to happen or arrive at a particular time 预定的；预期发生（到达）的
column3: e.g. They suddenly gave up the deal the day before they were [[due]] to sign the contract.

column2: leave a school or university before your course has finished 退学；辍学
column3: e.g. To everyone's surprise, Bill [[dropped]] out of college after his first year and joined a rock-and-roll band.

column2: think about sth. that happened in the past 回忆起；回顾
column3: e.g. When you [[look]] back on this experience in a year or two, it won't seem so bad.

column2: what is easiest in a difficult situation 省事的做法
column3: e.g. It is the easy way out to blame others for our failure though it doesn't make any sense.

column2: express your feelings about sth. through your behavior or actions, esp. when you have been feeling angry or nervous 用行动来表现情绪（尤指愤怒或紧张）
column3: e.g. These teenagers are likely to [[act]] out their feelings of insecurity by being moody and aggressive.

column2: have taken action so that sb.  某事物
column3: e.g. He found his job tedious and time-consuming and he was glad to [[be]] [[rid]] of it.

column2: suddenly think of sth. 突然冒出（想到）
column3: e.g. List the product's strengths as well as weaknesses at random as they [[pop]] into your mind.

column2: not to be caught or punished when you have done sth. wrong （做错事）不被发现，不受惩罚
column3: e.g. It's time they put a stop to his bad behavior. He's been [[getting]] away with it for too long.

column2: start to direct your efforts and attention to sth., esp. work 开始认真对待；开始努力做
column3: e.g. That's a tourism hotspot. I must [[get]] down to booking the hotel as soon as possible.

column2: not at all 绝不；一点都不
column3: e.g. It is by no means clear where the money is going to come from to fund this project.

column2: [C] 干枝条；干柳条；芦苇杆
bad-tempered and easily annoyed 脾气坏的；易怒的
column3: e.g. I have not had enough sleep lately and I am feeling kind of [[grumpy]].

column2: form a picture of sb. / sth. in your mind 设想；想象
column3: e.g. An architect can look at a drawing and [[visualize]] a three-dimensional shape.

column2: 1) [C] a piece of work that a student is asked to do （学生的）作业
column3: e.g. Students will need to complete three written [[assignments]] this semester.；e.g. She told me that she will be in Greece next week on [[assignment]] for one of the national newspapers.

column2: 2) [C, U] a piece of work that is given to sb. as part of their job （分配的）任务
column3: e.g. Students will need to complete three written [[assignments]] this semester.；e.g. She told me that she will be in Greece next week on [[assignment]] for one of the national newspapers.

column2: laugh at sb. or shout rude remarks at them to show that you do not respect them 嘲笑；嘲弄
column3: e.g. After the match, the disappointed fans were all [[jeering]] at the football team.

column2: (not in progressive) surprise or upset sb. so much that they do not react immediately 使（某人）震惊
column3: e.g. Sasha was too [[stunned]] by what had happened in the office to say a word.

column2: (fml.) (~ with) continue doing sth. that has already been started; continue being done 继续进行；继续做
column3: e.g. The discussions between the two firms are [[proceeding]] slowly but satisfactorily.

column2: form or make sth. form a curved shape（使）拱起；（使）成拱形
column3: e.g. His eyebrows [[arched]] as if he were angry.

column2: [C] 眉（毛）
raise one's shoulders slightly to express doubt, indifference, ignorance, etc. 耸（肩）（以示怀疑、 与己无关、不知道等）
column3: e.g. He [[shrugged]] his shoulders as if to say that there was nothing he could do about it.

column2: [C] a house or an area of a city that is in very bad condition, where very poor people live （城市中的）贫民窟，贫民区
column3: e.g. My friend Bobby lives with his three sisters in a [[slum]] near the city center, but he doesn't lose faith in life.

column2: marketable goods, skills, etc. can be sold easily because people want them （商品、技能等）有市场的，有销路的，畅销的
column3: e.g. The program is designed to provide students with real, [[marketable]] skills.

column2: showing too much satisfaction with your own cleverness or success — used to show disapproval 自满的，自鸣得意的，沾沾自喜的（含贬义）
column3: e.g. Peter was wearing an unbearably [[smug]] expression and waving the tickets in front of me.

column2: [C] an unpleasant look suggesting lust or ill will 挑逗性的或不怀好意的目光
column3: e.g. He has a most unpleasant [[leer]].

column2: [C]1) [usu. pl.] the length, height, width, depth or diameter of sth. 大小；尺寸
column3: e.g. It is important to measure the exact [[dimensions]] of the room before buying furniture.；e.g. You can have a spiritual [[dimension]] to your life without being religious.

column2: 2) a part of a situation or a quality involved in it （形势或品质的）方面，层面
column3: e.g. It is important to measure the exact [[dimensions]] of the room before buying furniture.；e.g. You can have a spiritual [[dimension]] to your life without being religious.

column2: think about sth. seriously for a period of time 深思；细想
column3: e.g. As he lay in his hospital bed that night, he cried as he [[contemplated]] his future.；e.g. Many years ago he had [[contemplated]] writing a book about his childhood.

column2: think about sth. that you might do in the future 打算；想；考虑
column3: e.g. As he lay in his hospital bed that night, he cried as he [[contemplated]] his future.；e.g. Many years ago he had [[contemplated]] writing a book about his childhood.

column2: [C] a large building for storing large quantities of goods 仓库；货栈
column3: e.g. Police are investigating a fire at a furniture [[warehouse]].

column2: 1) [C] a single seed of corn, wheat, etc. 谷粒
column3: e.g. Mum must have left in a hurry, since there were quite a few [[grains]] of corn left on the floor.；e.g. The government intends to import only five percent of the country's [[grain]].

column2: 2) [U] the seeds of crops such as corn, wheat or rice that are gathered for use as food, or these crops themselves 谷物；粮食
column3: e.g. Mum must have left in a hurry, since there were quite a few [[grains]] of corn left on the floor.；e.g. The government intends to import only five percent of the country's [[grain]].

column2: relating to industry or the people working in it 工业的；产业工人的
column3: e.g. Reports showed [[industrial]] production rose 1.3 percent in November from the month before.

column2: [U] (also revenues) money that a business or organization receives over a period of time, esp. from selling goods or services （公司、机构的）收益，收入
column3: e.g. These companies are sure to encounter financial trouble if they only rely on advertising [[revenue]] for funding.

column2: [C] a person whose job is to kill animals such as rats or mice, because they are annoying or dangerous 职业的消灭害虫者
column3: e.g. Can you believe that nearly one hundred million rats are killed each year by pest [[exterminators]]?

column2: a plan, idea, or method that is feasible is possible and is likely to work （计划、想法或方法）可行的，可实行的，行得通的
column3: e.g. It was no longer financially [[feasible]] to keep the community center open.

column2: look angrily at sb. for a long time 怒目而视
column3: e.g. Noah was furious at what I just said but he didn't shout and just [[glared]] at me silently.

column2: in a way that is deliberately meant to show that you are annoyed, bored, or disapprove of sth. 明确地；尖锐地；直言不讳地
column3: e.g. Miss Phillips looked at the clock [[pointedly]] and I realized that it was time for me to leave.

column2: [C]1) a complaint 抱怨
column3: e.g. They've got the usual moans and [[groans]] like everybody else.；e.g. The rescuers could hear the [[groans]] of someone trapped in the ruins.

column2: 2) a long deep sound that you make when you are in pain or do not want to do sth. （疼痛时的）呻吟；（不愿做某事时的）哼哼声
column3: e.g. They've got the usual moans and [[groans]] like everybody else.；e.g. The rescuers could hear the [[groans]] of someone trapped in the ruins.

column2: loud enough for you to hear it 听得见的
column3: e.g. His voice was barely [[audible]] above the noise of the crowd.

column2: stop sb. from continuing what they are saying or doing by suddenly speaking to them, making a noise, etc. 打断某人的讲话；中断某人的行动；打扰
column3: e.g. I'm sorry to [[interrupt]] your meeting, but may I speak to Michael for a moment?

column2: [C] (fml.)1) sth. that is certain to be successful 稳操胜券的事
column3: e.g. His new movie is predicted by many critics to be this season's [[slam]] [[dunk]] hit.；e.g. He marked his first appearance with a [[slam]] [[dunk]] for his first points.

column2: 2) (in basketball) the act of jumping up and putting the ball through the net with a lot of force 强力灌篮；扣篮
column3: e.g. His new movie is predicted by many critics to be this season's [[slam]] [[dunk]] hit.；e.g. He marked his first appearance with a [[slam]] [[dunk]] for his first points.

column2: (fml.) repeating the actual words that were spoken or written 逐字的（地）；一字不差的（地）
column3: e.g. The president's speeches are regularly reproduced [[verbatim]] in the state-run newspapers.

column2: if leaves, papers, clothes, etc. rustle, or if you rustle them, they move about and make a soft, dry sound （使）（树叶、纸、衣物等）沙沙作响
column3: e.g. A gentle breeze blew through the windows, lightly [[rustling]] the curtains.

column2: done quickly and with a lot of activity, but in a way that is not very well organized 紧张忙乱的；手忙脚乱的
column3: e.g. People were [[frantic]], trying to call relatives after the earthquake.

column2: done in a hurried way and in a state of excitement or confusion 手忙脚乱地
column3: e.g. I've been working [[frantically]] all week to get the term paper finished before the deadline.

column2: (pl. indexes) an alphabetical list of names, subjects, etc. at the back of a book, with the numbers of the pages where they can be found （书后的）索引
column3: e.g. Look under B in the [[index]] to see if biology is covered in the book.

column2: 1) (also ~ enough) used to say that sth. seems strange or surprising 奇怪的是；真奇怪
column3: e.g. [[Oddly]] enough, someone asked me the same question yesterday.；e.g. Didn't you think she was behaving very [[oddly]] at Susan's birthday party yesterday?

column2: 2) in a strange or unusual way 奇怪地；古怪地；异常地
column3: e.g. [[Oddly]] enough, someone asked me the same question yesterday.；e.g. Didn't you think she was behaving very [[oddly]] at Susan's birthday party yesterday?

column2: used to say the opposite of a situation you have just described is also true 反之亦然
column3: e.g. He refuses to believe anything they say and vice versa.

column2: stop doing sth. that is failing, so that one does not waste any more money, time, or effort 及早脱手以减少损失
column3: e.g. [[Cut]] your losses with projects that are not going to work and do things that make you feel comfortable.

column2: put your possessions into a bag, etc. before leaving a place （在离开前）收好物品
column3: e.g. We arrived just as the musicians were [[packing]] up their instruments.

column2: have a big smile on your face that clearly shows you are happy or amused 咧着嘴笑
column3: e.g. He tiptoed closer, [[smiling]] broadly, waiting for Suzanne to spot him.

column2: make sth. less or smaller 削减
column3: e.g. Some business owners are [[cutting]] into their profits to help raise money for the foundation.

column2: used to say that a particular choice would be more satisfactory 更好的选择是
column3: e.g. I started to hunt for a cheap restaurant nearby or, better still, a snack shop.

column2: give sth. to each person in a group 分发；散发
column3: e.g. He was busy [[handing]] out leaflets on the musical to the audience.

column2: find an explanation or solution to a problem, by thinking all the possibilities （通过推理）解释，解决
column3: e.g. I spent the entire night [[reasoning]] out the solution to the puzzle.

column2: think carefully about the possible results of sth. 认真地考虑（某事可能产生的结果）
column3: e.g. People need time to [[think]] through what the changes in taxation will mean for them.
